alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 02 at 12:21PM ChST until March 02 at 7:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...STRONG DAYTIME WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS MAY LEAD TO RAPID FIRE SPREAD ACROSS PARTS OF GUAM... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM THIS EVENING... * WIND...Sustained 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph during the afternoon. * HUMIDITY...As low as 55 to 60 percent possible in the afternoon. * HIGHEST THREAT...Southern part of Guam, mainly along and south of Cross Island Road. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...Wetting rain today helped a little with keeping the conditions below Red Flag warning criteria. About 0.25 to 0.50 inches of rain has fallen across the island since yesterday, with strong winds again today drying the fuels further. Fuel stick readings are around 13 today.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
